contextId.information: "what people call God's foolishness is really wiser than what people call wisdom, and what people call God's weakness is really stronger than people's strength" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: the foolishness of God is wiser than people, and the weakness of God is stronger than people

contextId.information: Paul wants the Corinthians to answer the question in their minds so he does not have to tell them. AT: "You know that I am not saying that food sacrificed to an idol is not important." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Or that food sacrificed to an idol is anything?

contextId.information: "but then we will see Christ face to face" This means that we will be physically present with Christ.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
